intro: Cephalandra decipiens, commonly known as the false ivy or creeping ivy, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often used as a decorative ground cover in tropical gardens. Its botanical features make it an attractive and low-maintenance plant for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
